article_metadata.description: Every day, Americans deliver into the hands of banks, hospitals, retailers and government agencies the most intimate personal, medical and financial details in the expectation that the information will remain confidential. And almost daily, they learn of instances in which that information is released or lost carelessly, or stolen by computer hackers.
